festival.introText:
FEARFEST is COMING!

THE 11TH YEAR ANNIVERSARY!!

MAGNA, SHEFFIELD

If you have ever been to FEARFEST before you’ll know how big this event is! The biggest acts from all over the world & the biggest production you’ll see on any Halloween event in the UK! Well imagine that and double it, because this is the 11TH YEAR & it's gonna blow you away!!! Do not wait on this one! Grab your tickets now and trust us...THIS WILL BE AN HALLOWEEN EVENT LIKE NO OTHER!!
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of FearFest. Get FearFest tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com
festival.location: Magna Science Adventure Centre in Rotherham

reviews.title: Review of FEARFEST 22
reviews.body: Was one of best fests Iâve been to put it that way

reviews.body: Need the bigger second room open like last year and lights werenât as good as last year either Ovs was sick bit mainly open that second wear-house was better than the tent

reviews.title: Review of FEARFEST 22
reviews.body: Was so disappointed with this year's event, have been a few times in the past and has always been a really good experience, but this year was a total mess. Couldn't get into the corridor to get to any of the stages as security were turning people away as it was too full. Due to the one way system, we couldn't turn back to get to the entrance space. We were stuck outside and unable to go anywhere, with more people being pushed out into this space and it becoming way over crowded which caused me to have my first ever panic attack. Really gutted about this as we then left without having seen any acts as we couldn't access the stages and didn't know what else to do as I couldn't put myself back into the position I was in where I had a panic attack. Thankfully, the security were really understanding and let me go contraflow to the one way system so I could get out, they offered for me to go to medical but I just wanted to get some water and fresh air and leave. I was completely sober at this point, having had a couple of drinks at home and not having the chance to get any while I was there. I think security realised that it was a total nightmare but it was absolutely out of their hands, and I really appreciated them helping me out. Overall, just super disappointed as like I said it has always been a great way to spend halloween and the lineup was amazing so we were really looking forward to it, but it just totally went wrong this year â¹ï¸

faqs.question: When is Fearfest 2023?
faqs.answer:
Fearfest 2023 takes place on Saturday 28th October 2023.

 

Saturday 29th October 2022

Saturday 29th October 2022

faqs.question: Travel information
faqs.answer:
Magna is located on: Magna Way, Rotherham, S60 1FD. Pedestrian access is available from Sheffield Road, S60 1DX.

If you are travelling using a sat nav then the postcode S60 1FD will bring you on to Magna Way, after which Magna is the big, black building straight ahead.

From the M1 take junction 33 if you are travelling from the south, and junction 34 if you are travelling from the north. Magna is about 1 mile from Meadowhall Shopping Centre and there is free parking for up to 400 cars and 40 coaches.

 

By Coach

If you are travelling by National Express coaches, alight at Sheffield Interchange and take the X1 bus route, as detailed below.

The nearest Supertram stops are at Carbrook and Meadowhall. You can then take a short walk to the X1 bus stops, and this bus service stops right outside Magna.

 

By Train

The most convenient train stations to use are Rotherham Central, Sheffield and Meadowhall.

From either of these stations you are advised to take the no.X1 bus service direct to Magna. From Sheffield station walk to the Interchange (about 4 mins) to catch the bus. From Rotherham Central, turn right out of the station into the bus station and take the X1 bus (stop B4). 

 

By Bus

The new X1 Steel Link service drops visitors right outside Magna, up to every 10 mins.   Travelling from Sheffield City Centre, you can catch the X1 Steel Link from bus stops on Eyre Street (ES3), Castle Street (CG22) and Arundel Gate (CS3).  From areas around Sheffield, travel on your local bus to the city centre and then jump on the X1 Steel Link at your most convenient stop.  

The X1 Steel Link travels from Maltby through Rotherham, picking up at the Interchange stand B4, and on to Magna.   Taking only 5 mins, travelling to Magna couldn’t be easier from Meadowhall Interchange stand C3 on the X1 Steel Link.

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Fearfest?
faqs.answer: No, there is no camping at FF22 as it is a one day event.

faqs.question: How much are tickets for Fearfest?
faqs.answer: Tickets for Fearfest 2023 are on sale starting at £40 + booking fee.

faqs.question: Where is Fearfest?
faqs.answer: Magna is located on: Magna Way, Rotherham, S60 1FD. Pedestrian access is available from Sheffield Road, S60 1DX.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: What are the entry times to Fearfest?
Do you have to wear fancy dress to Fearfest?
faqs.answer:
Fancy dress is optional.

Otherwise dress smart / comfortable (No tracksuits / man bags)

Hats & trainers are OK.
